sentences.sContent: He knew he could be free in as little as three years.
sentences.sCn: 他知道只要再过三年他就能自由了。

sentences.sContent: With one leap he was free!
He walked out of the courtroom a free man .
sentences.sCn: 他从法庭走出来，成了自由人。

sentences.sContent: They have called on the government to set all political prisoners free .
sentences.sCn: 他们呼吁政府释放所有政治犯。

sentences.sContent: He was found not guilty and walked free from the court.
The animals are allowed to run free in the park.
sentences.sCn: 那些动物可以在公园里自由奔跑。

sentences.sContent: ...We also have a free airport shuttle service...
...Some students think take-home exams will eat up their free time...
...as opposed to using my free time at home to work on a test...
...I’ll be free at 3 o’clock this afternoon...
...she refused to pay for a doctor and spent hours looking for free medical help...
...and to get a free bone for her much loved dog...
...I’ ll ask Janet if she is free then...
...Pang's first job is to free you from the common misconception that doing two things at once allows you to get more done...
...Even when Young Doc Bess would set up the basketball team with free Cokes after one of many victories...

synos.tran: [经]免费的；自由的，不受约束的；[化学]游离的

phrases.pCn: adj. 无…的；摆脱…的；在…外面
adj. 无拘无束的；过分随便的；马虎的
没有义务的；没有牵连的
自由访问；自由存取；自由入口

words.tran: 自由地；免费地；大量地；慷慨地；直率地
使自由；解放（free的过去分词）

trans.tranOther: not held, tied up, or kept somewhere as a prisoner
